titles.title: A resolution urging the Government of Kuwait to compensate United States citizens and their families for financial losses incurred as a result of their evacuation during the Iraqi invasion of Kuwait.

action.text: Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR S9372)
Referred to the Committee on Foreign Relations.

calendar.text: Committee on Foreign Relations. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.

action.text: Committee on Foreign Relations. Reported to Senate by Senator Pell without amendment and with a preamble. Without written report.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 226.

vote.text: Resolution agreed to in Senate without amendment and with a preamble by Voice Vote.

bill.summary: 7/23/1993--Introduced. Expresses the sense of the Senate that the President should encourage the Government of Kuwait to compensate the American citizens and their families who were evacuated from Kuwait during the Iraqi invasion of August 1990 in accordance with applicable contractual, business, and financial obligations.
